title: Create "graspologic at a glance" page
body:
Would like to have a page (in documentation and/or readme, but leaning towards just documentation) that basically explains each module at an extremely high level and why it might be useful. Could have very simple infographics too.

Would probably reorganize the below to match module structure better, make full sentences, etc.

### Specialized graph algorithms
- Single graph embedding
    - Learn a low-dimensional representation of a network where each node is a point
- Multiple graph embedding (time series or otherwise)
    - Jointly learn low-dimensional representations of multiple networks
- Two-sample graph testing
    - Test for differences between two networks
- Graph matching
    - Learn a mapping between the nodes in one graph and those in another
- Statistical network model fitting and sampling
    - Fit statistical models given an observed network
    - Sample networks from a statistical model and its parameters
- Signal subgraph identification
    - Learn which part of a graph is most predictive of a graph-wise signal
- (soon) Fast community detection
    - Find modular components of a network
- (soon) Time series of graph anomaly detection
    - Find anomalous vertices or graphs from a time series
- (soon) Vertex nomination
    - Predicting similar nodes within the same graph or in another similar graph
### Useful but not graph specific
- Automatic clustering
- Plotting
- Alignment

Thoughts welcome.
